meanings.definition: Shock or excite (someone) into taking action.
meanings.sent1: The inspiring speech galvanized the crowd to stand up for their rights.
meanings.sent2: The urgent call to action galvanized the community to come together and help those in need.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected news galvanized everyone into a frenzy of preparation.
meanings.sent4: The sight of the finish line galvanized the runner to push harder than ever before.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's praise galvanized the student to strive for excellence in all areas.

meanings.definition: Coat (iron or steel) with a protective layer of zinc.
meanings.sent1: The workers will galvanize the metal to prevent rusting.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to galvanize the fence to make it more durable.
meanings.sent3: The blacksmith's apprentice accidentally tried to galvanize the wrong piece of metal.
meanings.sent4: The artist used a special technique to galvanize the sculpture and give it a unique finish.
meanings.sent5: The engineer recommended galvanizing the bridge to extend its lifespan.

meanings.definition: To stimulate or arouse to activity.
meanings.sent1: The music galvanized the party into full swing.
meanings.sent2: The coach's pep talk galvanized the team to play with renewed energy.
meanings.sent3: The smell of fresh cookies galvanized the children to come running to the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The scent of blooming flowers galvanized the bees into a buzzing frenzy.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the alarm galvanized everyone to evacuate the building quickly.
